name: Oswald Karch
introduction: Oswald Karch (born 6 March 1917 and died 28 January 2009) was a German racing driver who primarily raced in Formula Two races within Germany in the 1950s. In 1953, he participated in two German-based non-championship races using a privately entered Veritas. He also raced in the 1953 German Grand Prix at the Nrburgring in his privateer Veritas, but retired after 10 laps due to engine failure.
